Description of incident: An isolated administration error caused an encrypted file with the personnel information of one client's employees to be made available to the HR department of another client. A password-based registration system was already in place to prevent the wrong addressee from opening encrypted email, however, the email was addressed to the wrong client. The total number of employees who may have had their names and Social Security numbers exposed is unknown, but 473 residents of Maryland were notified of the incident.  On June 3, the other HR department notified ING that they had been sent the wrong information.
